did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The Stimmel Distilling Company Form consists of a single form with a price list on one side and an order blank on the reverse.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Stimmel Distilling Company was a distiller of liquors and beers located in Norfolk, Virginia. The company appears in the 1915 and 1916 Norfolk City directories. In 1916, the state of Virginia banned the sale of alcohol, which may explain why the distillery does not appear in subsequent directories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains an advertising and order form produced by the Stimmel Distilling Company based in Norfolk, Virginia. The front of the form lists the prices of whiskeys on special. The "Bottled In Bond" whiskeys listed include Winona Club, Holesum, Mellwood, Overholt, Old Taylor, Beechmont, and Pure Corn. The form also lists the prices of some of the "High Grade Blends" which include Tokyo Club, Silver Eagle, Tabard inn, Sherwood, Kentucky Judge, and Old Stimmel. On the reverse of the form is an order blank.
